Liberty Independent School District, as an equal opportunity educational
provider and employer, does not discriminate on the basis of race, color national
origin, sex, age, or disability in educational programs or activities that it operates or
in employment decisions. The district is required by Title VI and Title VII of the Civil
Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of
the Rehabilitation At of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act, and the Age
Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended, as well as board policy not to discriminate
in such a manner. (Not all prohibited bases apply to all programs.) Please refer to
board policies DIA and FFH for further clarification.
If you suspect discrimination please contact the Liberty Independent School District
Title IX Coordinator (for concerns regarding discrimination on the basis of sex) or
the Section 504 coordinator (for concerns regarding discrimination on the basis of
disability). The Coordinator for Title IX, Section 504, and any other discrimination
complaint is superintendent, Liberty ISD Administration Building, 1600 Grand
Avenue, Liberty, Texas 77575, phone number div.data-react-data-bundle:
{"notifications":[{"id":8057,"message":"Dear Parents, Guardians and Students,

In the coming days, Liberty Independent School District will provide further, more detailed information, on matters such as graduation, GPA, grade promotion, summer school, online lessons, paper packets, etc.

We thank you for your support of our district, our schools, our students and our teachers and staff.

Sincerely,
Cody Abshier, Ed.D.
Superintendent","type":"banner"}]}

div.div: LISD is proud to offer Senior Passes to citizens age 65 and older who live within the boundaries of LISD. Passes are available from the Superintendent's Office at the LISD Administration Building.

address.aria-label: Address for Liberty Independent School District
Phone number for Liberty Independent School District
Fax number for Liberty Independent School District

span.data-emptytext: Liberty Independent School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value: The Liberty Independent School District, as an equal opportunity educational provider and employer, does not discriminate on the basis of race, color national origin, sex, age, or disability in educational programs or activities that it operates or in employment decisions. The district is required by Title VI and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation At of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act, and the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended, as well as board policy not to discriminate in such a manner. (Not all prohibited bases apply to all programs.) Please refer to board policies DIA and FFH for further clarification. If you suspect discrimination please contact the Liberty Independent School District Title IX Coordinator (for concerns regarding discrimination on the basis of sex) or the Section 504 coordinator (for concerns regarding discrimination on the basis of disability). The Coordinator for Title IX, Section 504, and any other discrimination complaint is superintendent, Liberty ISD Administration Building, 1600 Grand Avenue, Liberty, Texas 77575, phone number 936-336-7213.

p.span: The Liberty Independent School District, as an equal opportunity educational provider and employer, does not discriminate on the basis of race, color national origin, sex, age, or disability in educational programs or activities that it operates or in employment decisions. The district is required by Title VI and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation At of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act, and the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended, as well as board policy not to discriminate in such a manner. (Not all prohibited bases apply to all programs.) Please refer to board policies DIA and FFH for further clarification. If you suspect discrimination please contact the Liberty Independent School District Title IX Coordinator (for concerns regarding discrimination on the basis of sex) or the Section 504 coordinator (for concerns regarding discrimination on the basis of disability). The Coordinator for Title IX, Section 504, and any other discrimination complaint is superintendent, Liberty ISD Administration Building, 1600 Grand Avenue, Liberty, Texas 77575, phone number 936-336-7213.

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
